intro: Helminthospermum glabrescens, commonly known as the smooth bladdergrass, is a perennial herb native to the eastern United States. It belongs to the grass family (Poaceae) and is characterized by its slender, upright stems and small, spike-like inflorescences. The plant typically grows in moist to wet habitats such as marshes, swamps, and along stream banks. Its leaves are narrow and often have a slightly hairy texture, while the flowers are small and inconspicuous. Helminthospermum glabrescens plays a role in stabilizing soil in wetland environments and supports local insect and bird populations.
